episodeTitle: Luffy and Sanji's Daring Rescue Mission!
episodeTitleJapanese: 決死のルフィとサンジ！救出大作戦！
episodeTitleRomanized: Kesshi no Rufi to Sanji! Kyūshutsu daisakusen!
description: Luffy and Sanji attempt a daring rescue mission to free Zoro and Usopp from the G-8 Marine base prison. Meanwhile, Usopp creates an elaborate lie claiming the real Inspector Shepherd is a fake crew member named 'Condoriano', leading to one of the funniest moments in One Piece history.

events.title: Inspector Shepherd Arrives at the Brig
events.description: The real Inspector Shepherd is mistakenly thrown into the brig with Zoro and Usopp after Robin impersonated him earlier. The Marines believe he is an imposter, setting up the famous Condoriano scene.
events.significance: This sets up one of the most beloved comedic moments in One Piece filler history, demonstrating the confusion Robin's earlier impersonation caused.

quotes.text: I'm telling you, I'm the real Inspector Shepherd!
quotes.speaker: Shepherd
quotes.context: Shepherd desperately trying to convince the Marines of his identity

events.title: The Birth of Condoriano
events.description: Usopp, thinking quickly, claims that Inspector Shepherd is actually their crew member named 'Condoriano'. Zoro joins in on the ruse, and they both gaslight Shepherd into confusion. This creates one of the most iconic memes in One Piece fandom.
events.significance: This moment became legendary in the One Piece community, spawning the 'Con D. Oriano' meme and being referenced by fans for years. It perfectly showcases Usopp's quick thinking and lying abilities, as well as the crew's ability to work together even in absurd situations.

quotes.text: What are you talking about? You're Condoriano, our crewmate!
quotes.speaker: Usopp
quotes.context: Usopp creating the elaborate lie to confuse the Marines

quotes.speaker: Zoro
quotes.context: Zoro joining in on Usopp's deception

events.title: Zoro Headbutts Shepherd Unconscious
events.description: When Shepherd continues to protest that he's a Marine inspector and not 'Condoriano', Zoro resolves the situation by headbutting him unconscious.
events.significance: This comedic moment shows Zoro's direct approach to problems and adds to the absurdity of the Condoriano situation.

events.title: Luffy and Sanji Begin Infiltration
events.description: Luffy and Sanji discover that Zoro and Usopp are in the brig and decide to mount a rescue operation. They begin crawling through the base's ventilation system in a Die Hard-style infiltration sequence.
events.significance: This begins the main rescue mission plot of the episode and shows the crew's dedication to saving their nakama.

events.title: Luffy and Sanji's Contrasting Personalities in the Vents
events.description: While crawling through the ventilation ducts, Luffy finds excitement in the adventure while Sanji remains impatient and focused on the mission, creating comedic contrast between their personalities.
events.significance: This moment highlights the different personalities within the crew and provides character-driven comedy.

events.title: Jonathan's Trap
events.description: Vice Admiral Jonathan, having predicted the Straw Hats' rescue attempt, sets up a trap with Lieutenant Drake. The path to the brig is suspiciously empty, but Luffy and Sanji rush in anyway despite recognizing the obvious trap.
events.significance: Demonstrates Jonathan's strategic thinking and the Straw Hats' determination to save their crewmates even when walking into danger.

events.title: Seastone Bars Discovery
events.description: Luffy and Sanji reach the brig but discover that the prison bars are made of Seastone, rendering Luffy unable to use his Devil Fruit powers to break them. Sanji attempts to kick them down but finds them practically indestructible.
events.significance: This demonstrates the effectiveness of Seastone as a countermeasure against Devil Fruit users, a recurring element in the One Piece world. It shows the Marines' preparedness and strategic use of resources.

events.title: The Dial Mix-Up Comedy
events.description: To break through the bars, Sanji asks Usopp for the Impact Dial they acquired in Skypiea. However, Usopp accidentally gives him the Tone Dial first, which plays a recording of Luffy's flatulence. Then he gives him the Flavor Dial. This creates an embarrassing and hilarious situation before they finally get the correct dial.
events.significance: This is one of the episode's major comedic moments, showcasing the Skypiea dials they acquired and providing classic One Piece toilet humor. It demonstrates the crew's sometimes chaotic coordination while under pressure.

quotes.text: *Luffy's recorded fart plays from the Tone Dial*
quotes.speaker: Tone Dial
quotes.context: The embarrassing moment when the wrong dial is used

events.title: Using the Impact Dial to Escape
events.description: After the mix-up, Sanji finally receives the correct Impact Dial and uses it to create an explosion that helps the Straw Hats escape from the prison cell.
events.significance: Shows the practical application of the Skypiea technology and demonstrates how the crew uses their acquired tools creatively in different situations.

events.title: Getting Lost Following Zoro
events.description: After escaping the cell, the group follows Zoro to navigate the base, only to get lost due to Zoro's notoriously poor sense of direction.
events.significance: This is a recurring gag in One Piece, reinforcing Zoro's characteristic inability to navigate properly despite his combat prowess.

events.title: Robin's Strategic Analysis
events.description: Robin, who has been researching the base layout separately, identifies the only viable escape route and timing window for the crew to successfully leave the G-8 fortress.
events.significance: Demonstrates Robin's tactical intelligence and her value to the crew beyond combat. Shows her methodical approach to problem-solving.

quotes.text: What are you talking about? You're Condoriano, our crewmate!
quotes.speaker: Usopp

quotes.text: I'm telling you, I'm the real Inspector Shepherd!
quotes.speaker: Shepherd
quotes.context: Desperately trying to convince the Marines of his true identity

themes.description: The episode showcases the crew's unwavering dedication to rescuing their imprisoned nakama, with Luffy and Sanji willing to walk into an obvious trap to save Zoro and Usopp.
themes.symbolism: The prison bars represent the obstacles that can't separate the Straw Hat crew's bonds.

themes.description: Usopp's ability to create elaborate lies on the spot and Zoro's willingness to go along with them demonstrates the crew's adaptability and humor even in dire situations.
themes.symbolism: The Condoriano lie represents how the crew can turn any situation to their advantage through creativity and teamwork.

culturalReferences.description: The ventilation duct infiltration sequence is reminiscent of the classic action movie Die Hard

themes.description: Vice Admiral Jonathan's strategic mind versus the Straw Hats' determination and unpredictability. Despite Jonathan's careful planning, the crew's chaotic approach often works in unexpected ways.
themes.symbolism: The contrast between Jonathan's calculated traps and the crew's improvised solutions.

characterSpotlights.development: Usopp demonstrates his signature lying ability to create the legendary 'Condoriano' deception, showing how his seemingly negative trait can be useful.
keyActions: Creates the Condoriano lie to confuse the Marines
Accidentally gives Sanji the wrong dials
Eventually provides the Impact Dial for escape
quotes: What are you talking about? You're Condoriano, our crewmate!

characterSpotlights.role: Supporting the deception and comic relief
characterSpotlights.development: Shows his willingness to go along with Usopp's plans and his typical directness in problem-solving.
keyActions: Joins in on the Condoriano lie
Gets the group lost after escaping

characterSpotlights.development: Demonstrates his unwavering determination to save his crewmates, willing to walk into an obvious trap.
keyActions: Infiltrates through ventilation ducts with Sanji
Rushes into Jonathan's trap without hesitation
Unable to break Seastone bars due to Devil Fruit weakness

characterSpotlights.development: Shows his more serious side when crewmates are in danger, contrasting with Luffy's playful approach.
keyActions: Partners with Luffy in the infiltration
Attempts to break the Seastone bars
Deals with the embarrassment of the dial mix-up

characterSpotlights.development: Demonstrates her tactical intelligence by researching the base and identifying the escape route.
keyActions: Identifies viable escape route and timing
Provides strategic support from outside the prison

characterSpotlights.development: Shows his competence as a Vice Admiral by predicting the Straw Hats' rescue attempt and setting up appropriate countermeasures.
keyActions: Uses Seastone bars to neutralize Luffy's powers

mangaDifferences.difference: The entire G-8 Arc is anime-original filler content. This episode and the entire arc (episodes 196-206) do not appear in the manga at all.

trivia.fact: The 'Condoriano' scene from this episode became one of the most beloved memes in the One Piece fandom, with fans jokingly referring to the character as 'Con D. Oriano' to suggest membership in the Will of D.

sources.title: One Piece: Who is Condoriano from the G-8 Arc?

trivia.fact: This is Episode 200, a milestone episode number. The G-8 Arc is widely considered the best filler arc in One Piece history.

sources.title: One Piece: 10 Best Filler Arcs, Ranked

trivia.fact: The G-8 Arc was originally conceived as a theatrical film but was instead adapted into an extended anime arc.

sources.title: One Piece: 10 Best Filler Arcs, Ranked

trivia.fact: The ventilation duct infiltration scene is a homage to the classic action movie Die Hard.

The Impact Dial, Tone Dial, and Flavor Dial featured in this episode were acquired during the Skypiea Arc (episodes 153-195), making this one of the few times the crew uses Skypiea technology outside of that arc.
This episode aired on August 8, 2004 in Japan, during the height of One Piece's growing popularity in the mid-2000s.
